definition: growing as a thicket/overgrown/breaking out everywhere (of disease, social disorder etc)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: She came across butchered hedges and flowerbeds choked with weeds.
sentences.chinese: 她发现树篱被糟蹋，花坛里野草丛生。

sentences.english: Into the jungle of weeds that formed a natural fence along the road.
sentences.chinese: 他走进了路边的天然屏障，走进了杂草丛生的树林里。

sentences.english: The yard is a wilderness of weed and heaped of coal.
sentences.chinese: 院子里杂草丛生，煤堆满地。

sentences.english: A small bunch or bundle, as of straw, hair, or grass.
sentences.chinese: 一个非洲丛生美丽的草本属，有禾草状叶。

sentences.english: If you cut off some of the branches, the tree would not bush out.
sentences.chinese: 如果你砍掉一些树枝的话，这棵树就不会枝杈丛生。

sentences.english: Clumping nectar sources is more attractive to butterflies.
sentences.chinese: 丛生花粉植物对蝴蝶更有吸引力。

sentences.english: A drystone wall enclosed a graveyard where wildflowers grew.
sentences.chinese: 清水石墙环抱着野花丛生的墓地。

sentences.english: Eurasian primrose with yellow flowers clustered in a one - sided umbel .
sentences.chinese: 欧亚报春花，花黄色，丛生于单侧的伞形花序。

sentences.english: And if the path you choose is too overgrown to make further progress.
sentences.chinese: 如果你选的路线荆棘丛生，难以举步。

sentences.english: Nokia's path is certain pain followed by an uncertain future.
sentences.chinese: 诺基亚的前进道路上必然荆棘丛生，前途渺茫。

sentences.english: Elephants also use their trunks to yank up clumps of grasses and shove the greenery into their mouths.
sentences.chinese: 大象也会用鼻子拉起丛生的杂草，把草堆进嘴里。

sentences.english: Decadent injure the walls, and, weedy corner.
sentences.chinese: 颓圮的墙，还有，杂草丛生的墙角。

sentences.english: A man of words and not deeds is like a garden full of weeds.
sentences.chinese: 空有言语而无行动的人，犹如杂草丛生的花园。

sentences.english: A few plant individuals grow in small caespitose.
The creature had a long nose bristling with whiskers.
sentences.chinese: 那动物有著一只须毛丛生的长鼻子。

definition: to grow without restraint/overflowing with/to happen unexpectedly
to breed/to flourish/to cause/to provoke/to create
to grow (usually of abstract things)/to yield/to develop
branches and tendrils/fig. overcomplicated or digressive
twisted roots and intertwined joints (idiom); complicated and very tricky/knotty and deeply-rooted difficulties
intertwined (of tree roots or branches)/fig. an intricate matter
to go on the rampage/to riot/to run amuck
